divs: sighting detailsmy husband and i were swimming in our pool in our back yard. we live in the country, and are often able to see satellites. we watched a very bright satellite head move over head- roughly west to east, we think it was the iss( you could possible establish an exact time with this information) right afterward my husband noticed a very bright light ( different from the iss- much brighter) come from the the west\southwest area. he pointed it out to me, and we watched it move across the sky, going east\northeast pretty slowly. it was at a low altitude for a plane, and we both thought it was a plane that was taking off and gaining altitude and had it's take-off lights on. no lights flashed on the plane, and we waited to see if it would turn the lights off and the blinking lights on. when the object what at the very top of the sky, around the brightest star that is in the middle of the sky, the light began to dim. the light faded to a reddish color, and then disappeared altogether. we expecting to see flashing lights, or possibly dimmer lights, but the entire thing just disappeared. we continued to watch the trajectory for another couple of minutes, but lights never appeared again. we never heard a plane engine or any noise from the object, but to be fair, out filter on our pool was running, as well as the central air conditioning unit in our back yard. the light was very very bright and stayed the same brightness until it completely faded out. it was moving in a straight line, but did not appear to be gaining or losing altitude. we often watch the night sky, because we have such a fantastic view out here in the country. we have seen military craft ( my husband is a military aircraft buff),regular and private aircraft,meteors, satellites, the iss, and iridium flares, and nothing we have ever seen looked like this. to our knowledge, all aircraft must have lights on at night in american airspace.
Summary: Looked like a large aircraft with it's takeoff lights on, but only one visible light- bright
